title: Amazon launches Kindle e-reader for kids
text:
Amazon has launched a new Kindle e-reader - which is exclusively for children.

The Kindle Kids Edition comes with a one-year subscription to Amazon Fire for Kids, the child-friendly version of its Kindle book store.

It also includes parental controls so adults can monitor what their children are reading — and a two-year 'worry free' guarantee, meaning the device can be replaced for free at any time during that period if it is lost or damaged.

The £99.99 device will be released on October 30, which is perfect timing if you're looking for ideas for what to get the kids this Christmas, and it's available to pre-order on Amazon now.

The Kindle Kids Edition comes with a one-year subscription to Amazon Fire for Kids, the child-friendly version of its Kindle book store

The 6in Kindle Kids is just for reading, so has no access to the internet or social media, which means no distractions from apps, videos or games for your little ones.

It comes with a brightly coloured protective case and more than 1,000 age-appropriate books for them to enjoy. More books are available to purchase from the Kindle store.

Children can also improve their reading by completing goals based around words through the inbuilt Word Wise and Vocabulary Builder function, winning badges as they go.

The new device was unveiled following Amazon's successful line of Kids Edition Fire tablets.

In addition to the new Kids Kindle, Amazon has also launched an updated version of its Fire HD 10 tablet as part of its children's range.

The Fire HD 10 Kids Edition Tablet is the largest and fastest tablet for children the company has ever made.

It costs £199.99 and also goes on sale on October 30, but is available to pre-order on Amazon now.
